title.value: Genesis, modelling and methodological remedies to autism heterogeneity
title.justification: The title explicitly describes the scope and aim of the paper, focusing on the genesis, modeling, and methods to address autism heterogeneity.
title.quote: Genesis, modelling and methodological remedies to autism heterogeneity

extractions.description: This paper reviews the history of autism diagnosis and subtyping, demonstrating the heterogeneity in autism at the cognitive, neurological, and genetic levels. It discusses strategies to combat this heterogeneity including clustering and prototype recognition-based enrollment strategies.

type.justification: The paper provides a review and conceptual analysis of autism heterogeneity and proposes theoretical strategies to address it, rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: We present an alternative, new strategy for dissecting autism heterogeneity, emphasizing incorporation of prototypical samples in research cohorts...

name.justification: The paper is published in Neuroscience and Biobehavioral Reviews, indicating the primary focus on neuroscience.
The paper discusses psychiatric classifications and challenges in diagnosing autism.
name.quote: Diagnostic criteria used in autism research have undergone a shift...

name.justification: The paper explores the genetic aspects contributing to autism heterogeneity.
name.quote: ...and the evidence of heterogeneity in autism at the cognitive, neurological, and genetic levels.
